author: Staff Reporter
text:
Situation remained tense in Dindoshi and Kurar areas after activists of the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) had a face-off after a letter threatening MNS chief Raj Thackeray, allegedly written by BJP leader Mohit Kamboj, was circulated on social media.

Aggressive stand

Referring to the MNS chief’s aggressive stand against non-Marathi auto drivers and his order to burn new autos, the letter had warned that Mr Thackeray would have to pay a hefty price if even a single non-Marathi auto driver was hurt.

Irked by the letter, MNS activists vandalised the office Mr Kamboj on Saturday. On Sunday afternoon, Mr Kamboj was allegedly attacked by MNS activists at Kurar.

This led to a fight between activists of both sides and the police had to intervene.

Eighteen activists of the MNS and 20 BJP functionaries were detained. Heavy police bandobast was deployed in Dindoshi and Kurar areas to prevent any untoward incident.
title: MNS-BJP activists clash over threat letter to Raj Thackeray
